title: The Intelligent Investor
overview: Often described as the bible of value investing, The Intelligent Investor by Benjamin Graham teaches the principles of long-term, risk-averse investing. The book emphasizes fundamental analysis, margin of safety, and the psychological discipline required for successful investing. Graham contrasts defensive investors with enterprising investors, providing strategies for each approach. The updated editions include commentary that relates Graham's timeless principles to modern market conditions.
author: Benjamin Graham
author_overview: Benjamin Graham (1894-1976) was a British-born American economist, professor, and investor. He is considered the father of value investing and mentored Warren Buffett. Graham taught at Columbia Business School and wrote two investment classics: Security Analysis and The Intelligent Investor.

title: The Man Who Solved the Market: How Jim Simons Launched the Quant Revolution
overview: This biography tells the story of Jim Simons, the mathematician who founded Renaissance Technologies and pioneered quantitative investing. The book explores how Simons applied mathematical models to beat the market consistently, creating one of the most successful hedge funds in history. It reveals the secretive world of quantitative trading and the unique culture at Renaissance. The narrative combines finance, mathematics, and personal history to explain the quant revolution in investing.
author: Gregory Zuckerman
author_overview: Gregory Zuckerman is a special writer at the Wall Street Journal and author of several bestselling books about finance. He specializes in hedge funds and investment strategies, having covered financial markets for over two decades.
expected_learnings: How mathematical models can beat markets

title: Alchemy: The surprising power of ideas that don't make sense
overview: Rory Sutherland's Alchemy challenges conventional logic in marketing and decision-making. The book argues that many successful ideas seem irrational at first glance but work because they account for human psychology. Sutherland draws on behavioral economics and his advertising experience to show how 'illogical' solutions often solve problems better than purely rational approaches. The book is filled with entertaining examples that demonstrate the power of psychological insight over pure data analysis.
author: Rory Sutherland
author_overview: Rory Sutherland is Vice Chairman of Ogilvy UK and a leading figure in advertising. He co-founded the Behavioral Practice at Ogilvy and is known for applying behavioral economics to marketing. Sutherland gives popular TED Talks and writes columns for The Spectator.
expected_learnings: When irrational solutions work better than logical ones

title: Influence: The Psychology of Persuasion
overview: Robert Cialdini's groundbreaking work identifies six universal principles of persuasion: reciprocity, commitment/consistency, social proof, authority, liking, and scarcity. Based on years of research, the book explains how these principles work in various contexts from marketing to personal relationships. It provides both knowledge of how persuasion works and defenses against unwanted influence. The book has become essential reading in business and psychology.
author: Robert B. Cialdini
author_overview: Robert Cialdini is Regents' Professor Emeritus of Psychology and Marketing at Arizona State University. A pioneer in the study of influence, his research has shaped understanding of compliance psychology. He consults with businesses and governments worldwide.
expected_learnings: How compliance professionals use these principles

title: The Black Swan
overview: Nassim Nicholas Taleb's The Black Swan explores the extreme impact of rare and unpredictable events (Black Swans) and human tendency to find simplistic explanations for these events retrospectively. The book argues that unexpected events shape history more than predictable ones, yet we continue to focus on the predictable. Taleb discusses the limitations of statistics and forecasting, particularly in complex systems. The work has influenced thinking in finance, science, and philosophy about uncertainty and risk.

author_overview: Nassim Nicholas Taleb is a former trader, risk analyst, and professor who specializes in problems of randomness, probability, and uncertainty. He is the author of the Incerto series (The Black Swan, Antifragile, etc.) and has been a professor at several universities including NYU.
